titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Josie Prindle papers 1985.078
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-31 20:45:02 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The papers of Josie Prindle include 15 letters to Mrs. Prindle, some of which are from her husband Charles. Also included are a resolution of the Brooklyn City Guard concerning her husband, and a concert program of the Second Unitarian Church Choir from 1860, in which Mrs. Prindle was a soloist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Xerxes Fine and Rare Books and Documents in 1985.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Josie Prindle papers, 1985.078, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of Josie Prindle include 15 letters to Mrs. Prindle, some of which are from her husband Charles. Also included are a resolution of the Brooklyn City Guard concerning her husband, and a concert program of the Second Unitarian Church Choir from 1860, in which Mrs. Prindle was a soloist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.

controlaccess.geogname: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
controlaccess.corpname: Second Unitarian Church (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
